intro: Sagina nizzeana, commonly known as the rock moss or small white sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to rocky and arid environments. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its tiny, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in harsh conditions. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous or coastal regions. Sagina nizzeana is a hardy species that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
